con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cms/v2.3" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:schema="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cms/v2.3" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cms/v2.3" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:cms="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cms/v2.3"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Copyright (c) 2006-2016 HIPAAT Inc., All rights reserved.
Use of this document is restricted to the terms of the license that was granted by HIPAAT Inc.
HIPAAT INC. MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES ABOUT THE SUITABILITY OF THE SOFTWARE, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. HIPAAT INC. SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES SUFFERED BY LICENSEE AS A RESULT OF USING, MODIFYING OR DISTRIBUTING THIS SOFTWARE OR ITS DERIVATIVES.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <!--ConsentManagementRequest--> <xs:element name="ConsentManagementRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>All Requests to CMS are wrapped in a ConsentManagementRequest; it contains the definition for all requests to the Consent Management Service. Attributes: requestId - The request ID created by the caller; this is usually the transaction ID. It is stored in the audit log as a transaction ID. sessionId - The session ID assigned by the caller. userId - The user that submitted the request. serviceDeliveryOrgId - The service delivery organization from which the user submitted the request. request - The actual service request details. See the documentation for request below.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="requestId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="sessionId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="serviceDeliveryOrgId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="request" type="cms:Request" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <!--All requests will refer to Patient policies as the admin interface will--> <!--be supplied by HIPAAT and the service interface is not available to 3rd parties--> <xs:complexType name="Request"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>This is a list of commands/services that are provided by this service interface. Only one of these is allowable per Request. See the documentation for each command for more details.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:choice id="Command" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1"> <xs:element name="PutSystemCDRequest" type="cms:PutSystemCD"/> <xs:element name="ActivateSystemCDRequest" type="cms:ActivateSystemCD"/> <xs:element name="RevokeSystemCDRequest" type="cms:RevokeSystemCD"/> <xs:element name="ReorderSystemCDsRequest" type="cms:ReorderSystemCDs"/> <xs:element name="GetSystemCDRequest" type="cms:GetSystemCD"/> <xs:element name="ListSystemCDsRequest" type="cms:ListSystemCDs"/> <xs:element name="PutPolicyRequest" type="cms:PutPolicy"/> <xs:element name="ActivatePolicyInstanceRequest" type="cms:ActivatePolicyInstance"/> <xs:element name="RevokePolicyInstanceRequest" type="cms:RevokePolicyInstance"/> <xs:element name="RevokePolicyRequest" type="cms:RevokePolicy"/> <xs:element name="ReorderPoliciesRequest" type="cms:ReorderPolicies"/> <xs:element name="GetPolicyInstanceRequest" type="cms:GetPolicyInstance"/> <xs:element name="GetPolicyRequest" type="cms:GetPolicy"/> <xs:element name="GetPoliciesRequest" type="cms:GetPolicies"/> <xs:element name="ListPoliciesRequest" type="cms:ListPolicies"/> <xs:element name="ListEntityPoliciesRequest" type="cms:ListEntityPolicies"/> <xs:element name="SearchPoliciesRequest" type="cms:SearchPolicies"/> <xs:element name="MergePatientPoliciesRequest" type="cms:MergePatientPolicies"/> <xs:element name="UnmergePatientPoliciesRequest" type="cms:UnmergePatientPolicies"/> <xs:element name="MovePolicyRequest" type="cms:MovePolicy"/> <xs:element name="ListPatientsWithPoliciesRequest" type="cms:ListPatientsWithPolicies"/> <xs:element name="ListPatientOverridesRequest" type="cms:ListPatientOverrides"/> <xs:element name="ListActiveOverridesRequest" type="cms:ListActiveOverrides"/> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <!--GetSystemCD: Returns the requested System Consent Directive--> <xs:complexType name="GetSystemCD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves a System Consent Directive by its identifier. The parameter is a stringified UUID. Generally the client would do a list (ListSystemCDs) first, retrieving the identifiers, and then selecting one from that list.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ListSystemCDs: Returns the entire list of requested System Consent Directives--> <xs:complexType name="ListSystemCDs"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves the System Directives belonging to some specific criteria. The resulting list will be the CDs effective as of the date specified and may include CDs that have been revoked, depending on the setting of the includeRevoked flag. Some CDs have a "mustExecute" flag which indicates that they will supersede any patient policies. These can be isolated based on the mustExecute flag.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="mustExecute" type="xs:boolean" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="includeRevoked" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="false"/> <xs:attribute name="active" type="xs:boolean" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xs:date" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--PutSystemCD: Save or Update a System Consent Directive--> <xs:complexType name="PutSystemCD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Saves or updates the System Consent Directive. If the instanceId is missing or empty the request will be interpreted as an "add new" operation, otherwise the CD will be updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="SystemConsentDirective" type="cms:SystemConsentDirective"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--ReorderSystemCDs: Updates the priority of the System Consent Directives in the list--> <xs:complexType name="ReorderSystemCDs"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Reorders System Consent Directives in the order they are listed in the request. This request validates that the complete list of active CDs is provided and then alters the priority such that the CDs are evaluated in the order specified.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="CDInstances"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instanceId" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--RevokeSystemCD: Marks the identified System Consent Directive as being revoked--> <xs:complexType name="RevokeSystemCD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Revokes a System Consent Directive instance.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="userComments" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ActivayeSystemCD: Activates identified System Consent Directive--> <xs:complexType name="ActivateSystemCD"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activates a System Consent Directive instance.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--GetPolicyInstance: Returns the requested Policy instance--> <xs:complexType name="GetPolicyInstance"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves a Policy instance.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--GetPolicy: Returns the requested Policy--> <xs:complexType name="GetPolicy"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves the Policies belonging to a specific patient and policy ID. The asOfDate is used to return policies active for that date; default is all dates. The includeRevoked is used to further filter out policies that are not revoked active for that date; default is true. Generally the client would do a list (ListPoliciesRequest) first, retrieving the identifiers, and then selecting one from that list.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="policyId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="includeRevoked" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="true"/> <xs:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--GetPolicies: Returns the requested patient's Policies--> <xs:complexType name="GetPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves the Policies belonging to a specific patient and match the criteria. The resulting collection of policies WILL contain the list of CDs that belong to it. The asOfDate is used to return Policies active for that date; default is all dates. The includeRevoked is used to further filter out Consent Directives that are not revoked active for that date - default is true.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="includeRevoked" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="true"/> <xs:attribute name="active" type="xs:boolean" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ListPolicies: Returns the requested patient's Policies--> <xs:complexType name="ListPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves the Policies belonging to a specific patient and match the criteria. The resulting collection of policies WILL NOT contain the list of CDs that belong to it. The asOfDate is used to return Policies active for that date; default is all dates. The includeRevoked is used to further filter out Consent Directives that are not revoked active for that date - default is true.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="includeRevoked" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="true"/> <xs:attribute name="active" type="xs:boolean" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ListEntityPolicies: Returns the requested patient's Policies--> <xs:complexType name="ListEntityPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves the Policies belonging to a entity. The resulting collection of policies WILL contain the list of CDs that belong to it. The asOfDate is used to return Policies active for that date; default is all dates. The includeRevoked is used to further filter out Consent Directives that are not revoked active for that date - default is true.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="entityType" type="cms:entityType" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="entityId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="authType" type="cms:requestType" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="includeRevoked" type="xs:boolean" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--SearchPolicies: Returns the requested patient's Policies--> <xs:complexType name="SearchPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves a collection of historic policies that contain Consent Directives that match the criteria. The resulting collection of policies WILL contain the list of Consent Directives that belong to it. The createUserid and createFacilityId represent the user that is asking for the information for auditing purposes. The startDate is used to constrain the returned Policies to those that were last update on or after that date. The endDate is used to constraint the return Policies to those that were last updated on or before that date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="createUserId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="createFacilityId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="createStartDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="createEndDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--RevokePolicyInstance: Revokes all the CDs in the Policy instance--> <xs:complexType name="RevokePolicyInstance"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Revokes a Policy instance. All Consent Directives belonging to the Policy will be revoked.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="userComments" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--RevokePolicy: Revokes all the CDs in the Policy--> <xs:complexType name="RevokePolicy"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Revokes the specific policy ID belonging to a specific patient ID. All Consent Directives belonging to the Policy will be revoked.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="policyId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="userComments" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ActivatePolicyInstance: Activates all the CDs in the Policy--> <xs:complexType name="ActivatePolicyInstance"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Activates a Policy instance. All Consent Directives belonging to the Policy will be activated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--PutPolicy: Saves or Updates the Policy--> <xs:complexType name="PutPolicy"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Saves a new or replaces an existing Policy.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Policy" type="cms:Policy" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--ReorderPolicies: Updates the priority of the Policies in the list--> <xs:complexType name="ReorderPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Saves the Policies in the order they are listed in the request. All the active Policies must be in the list or the reorder will fail.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="PolicyInstances"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="instanceId" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded" type="xs:string"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--MergePatientPolicies: Merges polices from 2 patients--> <xs:complexType name="MergePatientPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Merges polices from 2 patients.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="curPatientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="obsPatientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--UnmergePatientPolicies: Unmerges polices from 2 patients--> <xs:complexType name="UnmergePatientPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Unmerges polices from 2 patients.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="patientId1" type="xs:string" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="patientId2" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--MovePolicy: Revokes original policy and recreates it for another patientID--> <xs:complexType name="MovePolicy"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Revokes original policy and recreates it for another patientID.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="Policy" type="cms:Policy" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="newPatientId" type="xs:string" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ListPatientsWithPolicies: Returns a list of patients with Policies, optionally only active policies--> <xs:complexType name="ListPatientsWithPolicies"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Returns a list of patients with Policies, optionally include revoked policies.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="includeRevoked" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="true"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ListPatientOverrides: Returns overrides for a specific patient for specified time period--> <xs:complexType name="ListPatientOverrides"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves a collection of policy overrides for a specific patient for specified time period.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="providerId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="facilityId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="startDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="endDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="testFlag" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="false"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ListActiveOverrides: Returns active overrides for a specific patient for specified time--> <xs:complexType name="ListActiveOverrides"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Retrieves a collection of active policy overrides for a specific patient for specified time.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="patientId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="providerId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="facilityId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="asOfDate" type="xs:date" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="testFlag" type="xs:boolean" use="optional" default="false"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ConsentManagementResponse--> <xs:element name="ConsentManagementResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ConsentManagementRequest contains the definition for all requests to the Consent Management Service. Attributes: requestId - The request ID echoed back. userId - The user that submitted the request. serviceDeliveryOrgId - The service delivery organization from which the user submitted the request. errorFlag - If an error is being returned. msgText - Messages returned from the service.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="requestId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="serviceDeliveryOrgId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="errorFlag" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="msgText" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:choice> <xs:element name="SystemConsentDirective" type="cms:SystemConsentDirective" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="Policy" type="cms:Policy" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="TemporaryOverride" type="cms:TemporaryOverride" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="patientId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <!--Policy: Contains all of the relevant info about a Policy--> <xs:complexType name="Policy"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A Privacy Policy (also called a Patient Policy), in Privacy eSuite, is a container for consent directives. The privacy policy can be used to group consent directives based on the purpose of use and any other criteria the patient or implementing organization deems appropriate. Each privacy policy contains one or more consent directives.
Attributes instanceId - The unique ID for this policy – it is generated by system.
Elements policyId - The user defined ID for this policy – it may be used in some views and reports. patientId - The patient ID recognized by the Consent System; must be consistent between all systems accessing the policy/consent directive. description - The user defined description of this policy. data - End-user defined data. This is not use by the system. mustExecute - Whether this policy is to be executed before the “non execute first” patient policies. classification - A customer defined value to further classify a policy. rank - The numeric priority of this policy. By itself it is meaningless as priority is determined in relation to other policies -- system will assign this value at save. usePassphrase - Used to indicate whether a pass phrase is to be used during evaluation. consenter - Identifies the person that is responsible for the creation of this policy. This may be different that the user that created it, especially when only a provider or privacy officer can administer policies on behalf of the patient. This identifies whether it was the patient or a substitute decision maker that initiated this policy. docLocation - Text that identifies the location (physical or URL) of any hard-copy or image of a signed version of this policy. realWorldPatientName - The patient's name. realWorldPatientId - A Real World ID associated to this patient; other than the patientId above. realWorldPatientIdType- The ID representing the type of Real World ID is stored. realWorldPatientIdAuth- The ID of the authority that maintains the Real World ID. revokeComment - Comments added by the user to explain why the policy was revoked. revokeReason - Reason why the policy was revoked. revokeUser - The user that revoked the policy. revokeTs - The date and time that this policy was revoked. effectiveDate - The date this policy takes effect. expiryDate - The date this policy expires. activatedUser - The user that activated this policy – the system will assign this value. activatedTs - The date and time this activated was created – the system will assign this value. createUser - The date and time this record was created. createTs - The user ID that created this record. updateUser - The user ID that last updated this record. updateTs - The date and time that this record was last updated. notes - This field can be used by the calling application to enter any notes for the policy. userComments - Comments added by the user. transactionId - The transaction ID used to create this policy. ConsentDirectives - The consent directives that belong to this policy.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="policyId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="patientId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="description" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="data" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="mustExecute" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="classification" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="rank" type="xs:int" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="usePassphrase" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="consenter" type="cms:consenter" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="docLocation" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="realWorldPatientName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="realWorldPatientIdAuth" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="realWorldPatientIdType" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="realWorldPatientId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="notes" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="userComments" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeComment" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeReason" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="expiryDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="activatedUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="activatedTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="createUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="createTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="updateUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="updateTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="ConsentDirectives"> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="ConsentDirective" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded" type="cms:ConsentDirective"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--ConsentDirective: Contains all of the relevant info about a CD--> <xs:complexType name="ConsentDirective"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In Privacy eSuite, each consent directive in a policy is self-contained and must maintain not only information about its creation, but also all the vital information necessary to perform an evaluation and determine an outcome.
Attributes instanceId - The unique ID for this consent directive – generated by the system.
Elements description - A user/application defined text description of the consent directive. title - A user-defined text label or heading for this consent directive. priority - The priority of this consent directive relative to other consent directives for this policy. A lower value represents a higher priority. purposeOfUse - The purposes of use that apply to this consent directive. directiveType - Identifies the type of consent directive. Allowed values: PHI, FAC privacyOperation - Identifies the type of request that this consent directive applies to. Allowed values: collection, use, disclosure decision - The outcome to be returned if this consent directive is applicable. Consent directive processing will continue to evaluate the next rule in priority order until an outcome (from action) of allow or deny is reached. Allowed values: none, allow, deny phiScope - Identifies the PHI that this consent directive will apply to. See the phiSpecifier element for a more detailed description. authorizedToView - Contains the list of users, roles, workgroups, facilities, … that are authorized to view this consent directive. appliesToRequestor- Contains the list of users, roles, workgroups, facilities, … that will be impacted by this consent directive. overrideAllowedFor- Contains the list of users, roles, workgroups, facilities, … that have the ability to override this consent directive.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="description" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="title" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="priority" type="xs:int" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="purposeOfUse" type="cms:purposeOfUse" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="directiveType" type="cms:directiveType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="privacyOperation" type="cms:privacyOperation" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="decision" type="cms:decision" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="phiScope" type="cms:phiSpecifier" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="authorizedToView" type="cms:Requestor" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="appliesToRequestor" type="cms:Requestor" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="overrideAllowedFor" type="cms:Requestor" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--SystemConsentDirective: Contains all of the relevant info about a System CD--> <xs:complexType name="SystemConsentDirective"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>System Consent Directives are rules assigned by the administrator; these rules will be applied to all the patients in the system. There are two types of system consent directives: Default – these rules will be evaluated after the patient policy Execute First – these rules will be evaluated prior to any patient policy
Attributes instanceId - The unique ID for this consent directive – generated by the system.
Elements description - A user/application defined text description of the consent directive. title - A user-defined text label or heading for this consent directive. priority - The priority of this consent directive relative to other consent directives for this patient (lower is higher). purposeOfUse - The purposes of use that apply to this consent directive. directiveType - Identifies the type of consent directive. Allowed values: PHI, FAC privacyOperation - Identifies the type of request that this consent directive applies to. Allowed values: collection, use, disclosure decision - The outcome to be returned if this consent directive is applicable. Consent directive processing will continue to evaluate the next rule in priority order until an outcome (from action) of allow or deny is reached. Allowed values: none, allow, deny phiScope - Identifies the PHI that this consent directive will apply to. See the phiSpecifier element for a more detailed description. authorizedToView - Contains the list of users, roles, workgroups, facilities, … that are authorized to view this consent directive. appliesToRequestor- Contains the list of users, roles, workgroups, facilities, … that will be impacted by this consent directive. overrideAllowedFor- Contains the list of users, roles, workgroups, facilities, … that have the ability to override this consent directive. mustExecute - Specifies whether this consent directive is to be evaluated before other consent directive. See explanation below. classification - Allows consent directive to be classified as a specific type; if not specified then indicates to the system that the consent directive is applicable to all classifications. docLocation - Identifies the location (physical or URL) of any hardcopy or image of a signed version of this consent directive. notes - This field can be used by the calling application to enter any notes for the policy. userComments - Comments added by the user. revokeComment - Comments added by the user to explain why the policy was revoked. revokeReason - Reason why the policy was revoked. revokeUser - The user that revoked the policy. revokeTs - The date and time that this policy was revoked. effectiveDate - The date this policy takes effect. expiryDate - The date this policy expires. activatedUser - The user that activated this policy - system will assign this value. activatedTs - The date and time this activated was created - system will assign this value. createUser - The date and time this record was created. createTs - The user ID that created this record. updateUser - The user ID that last updated this record. updateTs - The date and time that this record was last updated.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="description" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="title" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="priority" type="xs:int" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="purposeOfUse" type="cms:purposeOfUse" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="directiveType" type="cms:directiveType" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="privacyOperation" type="cms:privacyOperation" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="decision" type="cms:decision" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="phiScope" type="cms:phiSpecifier" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="authorizedToView" type="cms:Requestor" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="appliesToRequestor" type="cms:Requestor" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="overrideAllowedFor" type="cms:Requestor" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="mustExecute" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="classification" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="docLocation" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="notes" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="userComments" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeComment" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeReason" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="revokeTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="expiryDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="activatedUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="activatedTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="createUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="createTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="updateUser" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="updateTs" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="instanceId" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="purposeOfUse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A consent directive can be either assigned to all purposes of use, or a list of specified purposes of use. The purposes of use are system specific.
Elements all - Indicates whether this consent directive is applied to all purposes of use. value - A list of purposes of use this consent directive is applicable to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:choice minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xs:element name="all" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="value" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="directiveType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="PHI"/> <xs:enumeration value="FAC"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="privacyOperation"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="collection"/> <xs:enumeration value="use"/> <xs:enumeration value="disclosure"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="decision"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="allow"/> <xs:enumeration value="deny"/> <xs:enumeration value="none"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="requestType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="appliesTo"/> <xs:enumeration value="override"/> <xs:enumeration value="view"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:simpleType name="entityType"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="provider"/> <xs:enumeration value="user"/> <xs:enumeration value="facility"/> <xs:enumeration value="role"/> <xs:enumeration value="workgroup"/> <xs:enumeration value="department"/> <xs:enumeration value="jurisdiction"/> <xs:enumeration value="laboratory"/> <xs:enumeration value="pharmacy"/> <xs:enumeration value="payor"/> <xs:enumeration value="organization"/> <xs:enumeration value="dataWarehouse"/> <xs:enumeration value="userDefined1"/> <xs:enumeration value="userDefined2"/> <xs:enumeration value="userDefined3"/> <xs:enumeration value="userDefined4"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="consenter"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Identifies the person that is responsible for the creation of this consent directive; otherwise known as the Substitute Decision Maker. This may be different that the user that created it. If the requestor is not self, then name and roleCode must be entered.
Attributes isSelf - Is the patient the same person as the creator of this consent directive. name - Name of the Substitute Decision Maker (Last, First) that created this consent directive. roleCode - The role (or relationship) of the Substitute Decision Maker to the patient, that created this consent directive.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:attribute name="isSelf" type="xs:boolean" use="required"/> <xs:attribute name="name" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> <xs:attribute name="roleCode" type="xs:string" use="optional"/> </xs:complexType> <!--phiSpecifier allows the specification of the patient's PHI referred to by this directive in some way.--> <xs:complexType name="phiSpecifier"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>PHI Specifier, or PHI Granularity, allows the consent directive to be assigned for a specific type of PHI and its value. Only one type of granularity can be specified in the consent directive. HIPAAT recognized 4 types of granularity: Date Range, Context, PHI Classification, Confidentiality Code. If allPHI is false then only one of the above must be set.
Attributes allPHI - Does this consent directive apply to all PHI?
Elements operator - The operator to use EQ “equals” or NE “not equals” when comparing dateRange, phiClass, or confidentialityCode.
Elements - one of dateRange - A date range (fromDate, toDate, inclusive) indicates that this consent directive is applicable to PHI within the specified date range. Context - A collection of Name Value Pairs which identify the specific PHI context this consent directive is applicable to. phiClass - A collection of Coded Meta Data (code, code-system, code-system-version, display) which identify the specific PHI classifications this consent directive is applicable to. confidentialityCode - A collection of Coded Meta Data (code, code-system, code-system-version, display) which identify the specific Confidentiality Codes this consent directive is applicable to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="operator" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:choice minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xs:element name="context" type="cms:nvPair" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="phiClass" type="cms:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="dateRange" type="cms:dateRange" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="confidentialityCode" type="cms:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:choice> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="allPHI" type="xs:boolean" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> <!--DateRange--> <xs:complexType name="dateRange"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>dateRange is a simple construct that has start and end dates and a flag to indicate whether it should be interpreted as inclusive (ie. start <= test <= end) or exclusive (start < test < end)</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="fromDate" type="xs:date" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="toDate" type="xs:date" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="inclusive" use="required" type="xs:boolean"/> </xs:complexType> <!--nvPair (Name/Value Pair)--> <xs:complexType name="nvPair"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A collection of Name Value Pairs which identify the specific PHI context this consent directive is applicable to.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="value" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="operator" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--CodedMetaData provides an XDS-like metadata container--> <xs:complexType name="CodedMetaData"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A collection of Coded Meta Data (code, code-system, code-system-version, display).</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="codeName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="codeSystem" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="codeSystemVersion" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="displayName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--Requestor allows the specification of the user, workgroup, role, and facility impacted by this directive in some way. Can be used to specify applicability as well as who would be able to override the directive.--> <xs:complexType name="Requestor"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Consent directives can be applied to, or limited to, several different entity types. An entity type is an attribute of the provider and/or facility that is requesting access to patient PHI. HIPAAT recognizes the following predefined Entity Types.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="providers" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="users" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="roles" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="workgroups" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="departments" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="facilities" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="jurisdictions" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="laboratories" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="pharmacies" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="payors" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="organizations" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="dataWarehouses" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="userDefined1" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="userDefined2" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="userDefined3" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> <xs:element name="userDefined4" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1" type="cms:requestorSelection"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="requestorSelection"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Each requestor can be assigned one of 4 values: all, none, all except the specified, and none except the specified.
Elements includeAll - All are applicable to the consent directive rule. excludeAll - None are applicable to the consent directive rule. This means that no one is applicable. includeExcept - All are applicable to the consent directive rule except for the values specified. excludeExcept - None are applicable to the consent directive rule except for the values specified.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:choice minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xs:element name="includeAll" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="excludeAll" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="includeExcept" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="excludeExcept" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:choice> </xs:complexType> <!--TemporaryOverride: Contains all of the relevant info about a TemporaryOverride--> <xs:complexType name="TemporaryOverride"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>In the event of an override, the system will create a temporary override to allow the requestor access to the patient’s PHI for a system defined amount of time.
Elements patientId - The patient ID must be consistent between all systems accessing the consent directive, or a Master Patient Index must exist that we can check. entityTypeCd - The type of ID that requested the override. entityId - The ID of the entity type that requested the override. facilityId - The facility associated the request. privacyOperation - Identifies the type of request that this override was applied to. Allowed values: collection, use, disclosure transactionId - The transaction ID of the override request. subsDecisionMakerName - The name of the substitute decision maker that was responsible for allowing the override. subsDecisionMakerRelation - The relationship to the patient of the substitute decision maker that was responsible for allowing the override. overrideCode - The Coded Meta Data that defines the override reason. overrideReason - The optional plain text reason. effectiveDate - The date and time which this override started. terminationDate - The date and time this override stops.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="patientId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="entityTypeCd" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="entityId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="facilityId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="privacyOperation" type="cms:privacyOperation" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="transactionId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="subsDecisionMakerName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="subsDecisionMakerRelation" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="overrideCode" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="overrideReason" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="effectiveDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="terminationDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="test" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="ConsentManagementRequestSOAP"> <wsdl:part name="body" element="schema:ConsentManagementRequest"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="ConsentManagementResponseSOAP"> <wsdl:part name="body" element="schema:ConsentManagementResponse"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="consentManagementPortType"> <wsdl:operation name="ConsentManagement"> <wsdl:input message="schema:ConsentManagementRequestSOAP"/> <wsdl:output message="schema:ConsentManagementResponseSOAP"/> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="consentManagementBinding" type="schema:consentManagementPortType"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="ConsentManagement"> <soap:operation soapAction="http://98.143.106.139:8282/ConsentManagementService"/> <wsdl:input> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="consentManagementService"> <wsdl:port binding="schema:consentManagementBinding" name="consentManagementPort"> <soap:address location="http://98.143.106.139:8282/ConsentManagementService/"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

con:part.con:content:
<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cvs/v2.2" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:schema="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cvs/v2.2" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/"> <wsdl:types> <xs:schema elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cvs/v2.2" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:cvs="http://www.hipaat.com/schemas/cvs/v2.2"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Copyright (c) 2006-2016 HIPAAT Inc., All rights reserved.
Use of this document is restricted to the terms of the license that was granted by HIPAAT Inc.
HIPAAT INC. MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES ABOUT THE SUITABILITY OF THE SOFTWARE, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. HIPAAT INC. SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES SUFFERED BY LICENSEE AS A RESULT OF USING, MODIFYING OR DISTRIBUTING THIS SOFTWARE OR ITS DERIVATIVES.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <!--ConsentValidationRequest--> <xs:element name="ConsentValidationRequest"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ConsentValidationRequest contains the definition for all requests to the Consent Validation Service.
Attributes: 1. privacyOperation - What is the reason for this request: use, disclosure, collection Elements: 1. requestId - A request ID created by the caller; this is usually the transaction ID. It is stored in the audit log as a transaction ID. 2. userId - The provider that requested the patient's PHI. 3. serviceDeliveryOrgId - The business ID of the service delivery organization or location that the request was created. 4. purposeOfUse - An element that specifies the use of this request. The Purpose of Use is definable by the customer. THE FOLLOWING ARE SPECIFIC TO PHI 5. classification - An optional element that specifies the classification types of policies to be evaluated. This element is only used if "Classification" is enabled. 6. context - The context specifies the patient and optionally the patient's PHI to be accessed. A list of contexts is allowed; each context can be for the same patient, or different patients. See Context Element 7. override - An optional element that specifies that the request is for an override. See Override Element. 8. attributes - An optional element that specifies additional attributes about the provider (userId) that may be required for validation. 9. property - An optional element that contains information about the request. This information is not used during validation; instead it is placed into the audit log record.
Property is a collection of additional values, represented as Name Value Pairs, which are used as additional information that is passed onto the auditing service to be stored in the audit log record. Also, the validation service understands some of the properties; these are used as commands to do something other validation or perform the validation is a specific way. IS-ALIVE - Checks whether or not the validation process is alive. All values are not relevant since no validation is taken place. The result will be allowed=true and have the message "System Is Alive" in the RestrictionMessage section of the response. PATIENT-IN-CACHE - Checks if the patient ID is in the validation cache. The result will be allowed=true/false depending whether or not the patient exists in the cache and the message or either "Patient Exists" or "Patient does not Exist" in the RestrictionMessage section of the response. CONTAINS-DIRECTIVES - Checks if the patient ID has consent directives. This command will retrieve the data from the database. The result will be allowed=true/false depending whether or not the patient has consent directives and the message or either "Consent Directives Exist" or "No Consent Directives Exist" in the RestrictionMessage section of the response. CONTAINS-OVERRIDE - Checks if any overrides exist for the patient ID. This command will retrieve the data from the database. The result will be allowed=true/false depending whether or not the patient has consent directives and the message or either "Override Exists" or "No Override Exists" in the RestrictionMessage section of the response. IGNORE-OVERRIDES - Will perform consent validation for the patient ID as if overrides do not exist. TRACE - Will return a step-by-step trace of how the system came to the result. This is helpful when trying to understand how the system came to the final conclusion. The result can be found in the "trace" portion of the response.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="requestId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="serviceDeliveryOrgId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="purposeOfUse" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="classification" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="context" type="cvs:Context" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="override" type="cvs:Override" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="attributes" type="cvs:Attributes" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="property" type="cvs:nvPair" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="privacyOperation" type="cvs:privacyOperation" use="required"/> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:complexType name="Context"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The context element provides information about what the user is trying to view; which includes information about the patient and optionally information about the PHI: Elements: 1. patientId - The patient ID recognized by the Consent System. 1. assigningAuthority - The Assigning Authority of the Patient ID. 2. ContextQualifier - PHI Specifier. A collection of name-value pairs which identify the Clinical Metadata. 3. dateRange - PHI Specifier. An interval or single date that applies to the PHI in question. Generally, this is the date that the PHI was last updated. 4. phiClass - PHI Specifier. A coded meta data classification code for the data being requested 5. confidentialityCode - PHI Specifier. A coded meta data confidentiality associated with the PHI being requested.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="patientId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="assigningAuthority" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="ContextQualifier" type="cvs:nvPair" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="phiClass" type="cvs:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="dateRange" type="cvs:dateRange" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="confidentialityCode" type="cvs:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--nvPair (Name/Value Pair)--> <xs:complexType name="nvPair"> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="name" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="value" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--DateRange--> <xs:complexType name="dateRange"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A date range (fromDate, toDate, inclusive) that applies to the PHI in question. Generally, this is the date that the PHI was last updated. Attributes: 1. inclusive - Attribute. Specifies whether the dates supplied are inclusive or exclusive. Elements: 1. fromDate - Start date. 2. toDate - End date.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="fromDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="toDate" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> <xs:attribute name="inclusive" use="required" type="xs:boolean"/> </xs:complexType> <!--CodedMetaData provides an XDS-like metadata container--> <xs:complexType name="CodedMetaData"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A Coded Meta Data (code name, code-system, code-system-version, display-name) for the data being requested.
Elements: 1. codeName - The code name. 2. codeSystem - The system the code name belongs to. 3. codeSystemVersion - The version of the system the code name belongs to. 4. displayName - Human readable representation of the code name/system.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="codeName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="codeSystem" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="codeSystemVersion" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="displayName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--Enumeration of the types of access reasons supported--> <xs:simpleType name="privacyOperation"> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="collection"/> <xs:enumeration value="use"/> <xs:enumeration value="disclosure"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> <xs:complexType name="Attributes"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Consent directives can be limited to several different Entity Types. An Entity Type can be thought of as an attribute of a provider and/or facility. For any implementation, most of the above Entity Types will be disabled, but a few like role, workgroup, and/or department may be required in the creation of a consent directive. For example: "Allow only Emergency Department to have access to my PHI", or "Deny all Dentists access to my PHI". The Consent Validation Request contains the provider ID and facility ID; in most cases this is sufficient for the Validation Service to fetch addition information (the attributes, or meta data) of the provider and facility to evaluate the consent directives; for efficiency the Attributes element allows the requesting system to populate all the addition information (the attributes, or meta data) about the provider and facility so that the validation service does not need to fetch it. The Attributes Element can contain zero or more of any of the entity types listed above. The Validation Service uses the attributes together with a number of other inputs to adjudicate a response of 'Permit,' 'Deny' or ‘Permit through override.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="provider" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="user" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="facility" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="role" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="workgroup" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="department" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="jurisdiction" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="laboratory" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="pharmacy" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="payor" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="organization" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="dataWarehouse" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="userDefined1" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="userDefined2" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="userDefined3" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="userDefined4" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="Override"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>An override is an optional component of the request that is used to signal that the provider is requesting to override the patient's wishes in this request. At the very least, a valid override reason code is required to make this a valid request. An optional, text override reason is provided for further documentation to be recorded regarding the override request. If the override occurs as a result of the patient providing a PIN to the user and granting them override authority, the base64 version of the MD5 hash for PIN will be part of the Override segment.
Elements: 1. code - The coded meta data that defines the override reason. 2. reason - An optional plain text reason. 3. pin - In the case that the directive is controlled by a PIN, and the patient has provided that PIN to the provider, a correctly matched PIN will allow the override to take place as "patient consented". 4. substName - Name of the substitute decision maker that was responsible for allowing the override. 5. substRelationship - Relationship to the patient of the substitute decision maker that was responsible for allowing the override.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="code" type="cvs:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="reason" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="pin" type="xs:base64Binary" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="substName" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="substRelationship" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <!--ConsentValidationResponse--> <xs:element name="ConsentValidationResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>The ConsentValidationRequest contains the definition for all requests to the Consent Validation Service.
Elements: 1. requestId - A request ID created by the caller; this is usually the transaction ID. It is stored in the audit log as a transaction ID. 2. userId - The provider that requested the patient's PHI. 3. serviceDeliveryOrgId - The business ID of the service delivery organization or location that the request was created. 4. errorFlag - If an unexpected error occurred; other than the error messages listed below. 5. classification - An optional element that specifies the classification types of policies to be evaluated. This element is only used if "Classification" is enabled. 6. msgText - The message describing the error. 7. ConsentResponse - The actual results of the consent validation; corresponding to the Contexts supplied on the incoming request. See the documentation for ConsentResponse below.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:complexType> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="requestId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="userId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="serviceDeliveryOrgId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="errorFlag" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="msgText" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="ConsentResponse" type="cvs:ConsentResponse" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> </xs:element> <xs:complexType name="ConsentResponse"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Each ConsentResponse corresponds to the context element in the request; there is a one-to-one relationship between the request's contexts and the response's ConsentResponse.
Elements: 1. responseId - A unique ID generated by the validation service; this value is stored in the audit logs after validation is complete. 2. patientId - The echoed patient ID recognized by the Consent System. 3. ContextQualifier - The echoed collection of name-value pairs which identify the context. 4. dateRange - The echoed interval or single date that applies to the PHI in question. Generally, this is the date that the PHI was last updated. 5. phiClass - The echoed coded meta data classification code for the data being requested 6. confidentialityCode - The echoed coded meta data confidentiality associated with the PHI being requested. 7. validUntil - Represents the timestamp after which this result will no longer be valid. This is a convenience for any client system that would like to cache results. 8. allowed - The actual Boolean response. If missing, then no decision was made. 9. overrideable - If allowed is false, then overrideable may be true, indicating that a subsequent request, with an override would succeed. 10.restrictionMessage - A list of messages that, depending on the client, could be displayed to the user. 11.trace - A list of actions that were performed to produce the outcome.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="responseId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="patientId" type="xs:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="ContextQualifier" type="cvs:nvPair" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="phiClass" type="cvs:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="dateRange" type="cvs:dateRange" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="confidentialityCode" type="cvs:CodedMetaData" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="validUntil" type="xs:dateTime" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="allowed" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="overrideable" type="xs:boolean" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="restrictionMessage" type="cvs:restrictionMessage" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> <xs:element name="trace" type="cvs:trace" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="restrictionMessage"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>A consent evaluation can produce an outcome of "allow", "deny", or "display message". In the case of "display message", the user defined messaged is returned. The message text is intended to be displayed to the end-user. There are 2 types of messages: Patient and Organization.
Elements: 1. messageText - The message describing the outcome. This is usually the consent directive description. 2. policyDescription - The policy that was used to determine the outcome. 3. directiveDescription - The consent directive that was used to determine the outcome. 4. Type - See msgType below</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="messageText" type="xs:string"/> <xs:element name="policyDescription" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="directiveDescription" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="type" type="cvs:msgType"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:complexType name="trace"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Represents a step-by-step trace of how the system came to the result. This is helpful when trying to understand how the system came to the conclusion. The result can be found in the "trace" portion of the response.
Elements: 1. policyDescription - The policy that was evaluated. 2. directiveDescription - The directive that was evaluated. 3. messages - How the Validation Service came to this conclusion? The trace is delimited with |</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:sequence> <xs:element name="policyDescription" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="directiveDescription" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> <xs:element name="messages" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"/> </xs:sequence> </xs:complexType> <xs:simpleType name="msgType"> <xs:annotation> <xs:documentation>Each ConsentResponse corresponds to the context element in the request; there is a one-to-one relationship between the request's contexts and the response's ConsentResponse.
Elements: NO_CONSENT_APPLIED - No patient or system consent was applied to this decision. CONSENT - Temporary Override was requested. OR Consent was applied to this decision. PATIENT - Patient requested a message to be displayed. ORGANIZATION - Organization requested a message to be displayed. OVERRIDE - Temporary Override Found. MESSAGE - System Is Alive OR Consent Directives Exist OR No Consent Directives Exist OR Override Exists OR No Override Exists ACCESS_CONTROLLED_MSG - User is not allowed to view details due to permission – FUTURE. ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED - System not yet initialized. ERR_STALE_DATA - Possible Stale Data - No communication. ERR_MULTI_PATIENT_ID - Multiple Patient IDs are mapped to the RWID in request. ERR_NO_PATIENT_ID - Patient ID missing in request. ERR_NO_CONTEXT - Context section missing in request. ERR_NO_USER_ID - User ID missing in request. ERR_INVALID_INPUT - Other invalid request errors. ERR_INTERNAL - Depending on exception that was thrown.</xs:documentation> </xs:annotation> <xs:restriction base="xs:string"> <xs:enumeration value="CONSENT"/> <xs:enumeration value="PATIENT"/> <xs:enumeration value="ORGANIZATION"/> <xs:enumeration value="OVERRIDE"/> <xs:enumeration value="MESSAGE"/> <xs:enumeration value="NO_CONSENT_APPLIED"/> <xs:enumeration value="ACCESS_CONTROLLED_MSG"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_INVALID_INPUT"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_MULTI_PATIENT_ID"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_NO_PATIENT_ID"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_NO_CONTEXT"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_NO_USER_ID"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_STALE_DATA"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_NOT_INITIALIZED"/> <xs:enumeration value="ERR_INTERNAL"/> </xs:restriction> </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="ConsentValidationRequestSOAP"> <wsdl:part name="body" element="schema:ConsentValidationRequest"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="ConsentValidationResponseSOAP"> <wsdl:part name="body" element="schema:ConsentValidationResponse"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="consentValidationPortType"> <wsdl:operation name="consentValidation"> <wsdl:input message="schema:ConsentValidationRequestSOAP"/> <wsdl:output message="schema:ConsentValidationResponseSOAP"/> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="consentValidationBinding" type="schema:consentValidationPortType"> <soap:binding style="document" transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/> <wsdl:operation name="consentValidation"> <soap:operation soapAction="http://98.143.106.139:8282/ConsentValidationService"/> <wsdl:input> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="consentValidationService"> <wsdl:port binding="schema:consentValidationBinding" name="consentValidationPort"> <soap:address location="http://98.143.106.139:8282/ConsentValidationService/"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

con:request.name: PutSystemCD
